original_title: Sri Lanka may revise GDP growth target after 2Q data: CB Governor
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka may revise the 2023 gross domestic product target up after observing the economic performance in the second quarter, Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.
“We do have enough information at the moment to revise the forecast,” Governor Weerasinghe told reporters.
“We only have the first quarter data when the economy contracted 11.5 percent compared to last year. The second quarter will show a lower contraction.
“We can think that that the second half GDP growth may be higher than we originally forecasted. After the second quarter data is available, I think we may be able to revise the forecast.”
Though the first quarter GDP growth contracted compared to 2022, it was up 6.7 percent compared to December 2022.

Sri Lanka’s central bank has projected a 2 percent contraction for 2023 and a 3.3 percent positive growth for 2024. The IMF has projected a 3.0 percent contraction for 2023 and a 1.5 percent growth for 2024.
